title: New NBC Font
content:
NBC has been using a new font in its promos for a few months. Unfortunately, a screen grab of the video just gives me a mysterious black rectangle, so you'll need to check out the clip yourself:

[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cJteBqThugg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120501042348/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=cJteBqThugg "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cJteBqThugg")

Anyone recognize it?
author: pdxuser

comments.content:
It lookks a little like Myriad font  
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=427413&grab\_id=0&page\_id=20111&query=%22myriad%22&SCOPE=Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20120501042348/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=427413&grab_id=0&page_id=20111&query=%22myriad%22&SCOPE=Fonts)
Thanks for the screen grab, iDoc. The "a" on Monday at :07 is very distinctive, too.

I like Antenna, but it seems odd that they would switch so soon after their [Klavika](http://web.archive.org/web/20120501042348/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/klavika06.html) stuff which still looks quite current.

Thanks for the ID! They still use Klavika. I can't be sure, but I think Klavika is used in promos where they leave a show's logo intact, and Antenna is used when they replace logos with a cohesive font. I think single-show promotions mostly use Klavika, and there may be a distinction made for dramas vs comedies. During the summer, Avant Garde was filling the role of Antenna during their "All-American Summer" campaign.
